title: How to Use Publisher Rocket to Conduct Keyword Research For Your Low-Content Books

tactics.name: Keyword Research with Publisher Rocket
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to analyze keywords for low-content books by checking competitors, search volume, and earnings.
steps: Search for keywords using the keyword search tool
Analyze competitive score and number of competitors
Filter keywords based on estimated search volume and earnings
caveats: Amazon search data is estimated, not exact
source_quotes: Publisher Rocket shows estimated monthly search volume and average monthly earnings.

tactics.name: Competitive Score Analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate keyword competitiveness using Publisher Rocket's score metric
steps: Check competitive score thresholds (under 40 for new authors, up to 60 for low-content books)
Compare with average monthly earnings of top books
Analyze Amazon search volume to validate market demand
caveats: High search volume with low earnings may indicate poor quality books
source_quotes: the closer to one you can get the less and less competitive it gets
you can go for a competitive score of 60 and maybe even a bit higher

heuristics.name: Competitive Score Threshold
heuristics.condition: If competitive score is below 50, prioritize the keyword
source_quotes: Competitive score out of 100 indicates battle intensity.

heuristics.name: Earnings vs. Search Volume
heuristics.condition: If low average monthly earnings but high search volume, investigate quality issues
source_quotes: if you see any really low numbers that could mean one of two things

claims.statement: Amazon does not release exact search data, so Publisher Rocket provides estimates.
source_quotes: Amazon doesn't actually release its search data.

claims.statement: Low-content books can tolerate higher competitive scores than traditional fiction
source_quotes: with these low content books that are fairly easy and quick to create the risk really isn't that high

niche_patterns.description: Target specific demographics with niche constraints for lower competition.
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines identity (teen boys), problem (ADHD), and constraint (Christian) for precise targeting.
source_quotes: Look for keywords with lower competition and relevant niches.
